mapper.select: select user_no , user_name , user_phone , user_gender , to_char(to_date(user_birth), 'YYYY/ MM/ DD') as "user_birth" from tb_user where user_type = 'P' and user_status = 'Y' and user_pt = 'N' and user_no = #{ userNo }
mapper.update: update tb_user set user_pt = 'Y' where user_no = #{userNo}
mapper.select: select user_no , user_name , user_gender , user_birth , user_phone , cl_no , cl_sdate , cl_count from tb_user join tb_class using (user_no) where emp_no = #{empNo}
select re_no , writer_name , re_content , to_char(re_date, 'YYYY.MM.DD HH24:MI:SS') as "re_date" , writer_type from tb_reply where re_status = 'Y' and di_no = #{dietNo} order by re_no
